content:
I have looked up manual of lean3 and lean4, but find little about the role of file name.
Are file names insignificant in namespace hierarchy?
Pretty much file names are relevant for imports, namespaces can be broken up and declarations added to them in any Lean file, its a little like ruby.
That being said we often tend to at least reflect parts of the namespace hierarchy in the file hierarchy.

Henrik Böving said:

Pretty much file names are relevant for imports, namespaces can be broken up and declarations added to them in any Lean file, its a little like ruby.

So file hierarchy and namespace are theortically orthongonal?
I would have to first import the file and then (open the namespace / use namespace.identifier) to use item in another file?
Erika Su has marked this topic as resolved.
